revised_title: VIP-Containing Nerves in the Bladder and Sacral Cord: Implications for Nociception and Pain
tldr: This study investigates the presence of vasoactive intestinal peptide (VIP)-containing nerves in the bladder and sacral cord, and their potential role in nociception and pain. The researchers found that VIP is present in pelvic nerve afferent fibers, with a significant portion of VIP originating from ganglionic cells at the base of the bladder. These findings suggest that VIP may play a role in the modulation of pain and nociception.
